subject: Re: [junit] assertEquals error message
msgSnippet: ... In the meantime:  JUnit-addons. junitx.framework.Assert.assertEquals(String, String); -Vladimir -- Vladimir Ritz Bossicard www.ritz-bossicard.com
messageBody:
> Displays: "foobar expected: <... ...> but was <......>"
>
> This error message is useless for me. I work around it, of course, but
> it's making me go a lot slower. I would like to see this feature turned
> off or made more sophisticated by the introduction of more surrounding
> context (say, at least ten characters on each side). Any plans to fix
> it?

In the meantime: JUnit-addons.

junitx.framework.Assert.assertEquals(String, String);

-Vladimir

--
Vladimir Ritz Bossicard
www.ritz-bossicard.com
